subject: thoughts to live by
verse: What I am saying, dear brothers and sister, is that flesh and blood cannot inherit the kingdom of God. These perishable bodies of ours are not able to live forever. (I Corinthians 15:50) NLT
reflection: We all face limitations of one sort or another. Some may have physical, some mental, others emotional disabilities. Some may be blind, but they still can see a new way to live. Some may be deaf, but they can hear God's Good News. Some may be lame, but they can walk in God's love. In addition, they have the encouragement that those disabilities are only temporary. Paul tells us that we will all be given new bodies when Christ returns and that these bodies will be without disabilities, never to die or become sick. This can give us hope in our suffering.
prayer: Dear Heavenly Father, I thank You for the encouragement that these mortal bodies will be exchanged for a body which will last for all eternity, with not one disability. Amen.
original_content:
04/02/08 ~~~ (food for thought) ~~~ Authority makes some people grow and
others just swell...(Mt. 23:11, 12)

Our Bible Verse for Today:

What I am saying, dear brothers and sister, is that flesh and blood 
cannot inherit the kingdom of God. These perishable bodies of ours
are not able to live forever...(I Cor 15:50) NLT

Our Lesson for Today:

We all face limitations of one sort or another. Some may have physical,
some mental, others emotional disabilities...

Some may be blind, but they still can see a new way to live. Some may 
be deaf, but they can hear God's Good News...

Some may be lame, but they can walk in God's love. In addition, they 
have the encouragement that those disabilities are only temporary.

Paul tells us that we will all be given new bodies when Christ returns
and that these bodies will be without disabilities, never to die or become 
sick. This can give us hope in our suffering...

Our Prayer for Today:
Dear Heavenly Father, I thank You for the encouragement
that these mortal bodies will be exchanged for a body which
will last for all eternity, with not one disability...Amen.

Keep looking up, He wants to help you through your difficulties...
You are in the prayers of two who care...
Pastor Al & Marcie Sather

subject: thoughts to live by
verse: Paul says: "Listen I will tell you a mystery: We will not all sleep, but we will be changed ~ in a flash, in the twinkling of an eye, at the last trumpet. for the trumpet will sound, the dead will be raised imperishable, and we will be changed. (I Corinthians 15:51, 52) NIV
reflection: Christian who are still alive when Christ returns will not have to die, but will be transformed immediately. A trumpet blast will usher in the new heaven and the new earth. The Jews would understand the significance of this because trumpets were always blown to signal the start of a great festivals and other extraordinary events. What will you be doing when the last Trumpet blows? Will you be ready when the Lord returns?
prayer: Dear Heavenly Father, I pray that I would always be focused on You, so that when You return you will find me faithful. Forgive me be being less than faithful. Amen.
original_content:
04/03/08 ~~~ (food for thought) ~~~ Be more concerned about what God thinks of you 
than what people think about you...(Acts 5:29)

Our Bible Verses for Today:

Paul says: "Listen I will tell you a mystery: We will not all
sleep, but we will be changed ~

in a flash, in the twinkling of an eye, at the last trumpet. for
the trumpet will sound, the dead will be raised imperishable,
and we will be changed...(I Cor 15:51, 52) NIV

Our Lesson for Today:

Christian who are still alive when Christ returns will not have to die,
but will be transformed immediately...

A trumpet blast will usher in the new heaven and the new earth...

The Jews would understand the significance of this because trumpets
were always blown to signal the start of a great festivals and other
extraordinary events...

What will you be doing when the last Trumpet blows?
Will you be ready when the Lord returns?

Our Prayer for Today:
Dear Heavenly Father, I pray that I would always be 
focused on You, so that when You return you will find
me faithful. Forgive me be being less than faithful...Amen.

Keep looking up, even when we are not faithful
He is faithful, and will be faithful to the end...
You are in the prayers of two who care...
Pastor Al & Marcie Sather

subject: thoughts to live by
verse: When the perishable has been clothed with the imperishable, and the mortal with immortality, the saying that is written will come true: "Death has been swallowed up in victory." "Where, O death, is your victory? Where, O death, is your sting?" The sting of death is sin, and the power of sin is the law. (I Corinthians 15:54-56) NIV
reflection: Satan seemed to be victorious in the Garden of Eden (Genesis 3) and at the cross of Jesus. But God turned Satan's apparent victory into defeat when Jesus rose from the dead (Colossians 2:15); (Hebrews 2:14, 15). So, death is no longer a source of dread and fear. Christ overcame it, and one day we will too. The law will no longer make sinners out of us just because we cannot keep it. Death has been defeated, and we have hope beyond the grave.
prayer: Dear Heavenly Father, I thank You for paving the way to eternal life. I thank You that all who believe in the finished work of Christ no longer have to dread or fear death. I pray that a revival would come to world and that love for all mankind would reign supreme. Amen.
original_content:
04/ 04/08 ~~~~ (food for thought) ~~~ The trouble with the guy who talks to fast is that he
often says something he hasn't thought of yet...(Eccl. 5:2)

Our Bible Verses for Today:

When the perishable has been clothed with the imperishable, and the
mortal with immortality, the saying that is written will come true:
"Death has been swallowed up in victory."

"Where, O death, is your victory? Where, O death, is your sting?"

The sting of death is sin, and the power of sin is the law...(I Cor. 15:54-56) NIV

Our Lesson for Today:

Satan seemed to be victorious in the Garden of Eden (Gen. 3) and at the cross
of Jesus. But God turned Satan's apparent victory into defeat when Jesus rose
from the dead (Col. 2:15); (Heb. 2:14, 15)...

So, death is no longer a source of dread and fear. Christ overcame it, and one
day we will too...

The law will no longer make sinners out of us just because we cannot keep it.
Death has been defeated, and we have hope beyond the grave...

Our Prayer for Today:
Dear Heavenly Father, I thank You for paving the way to eternal
life. I thank You that all who believe in the finished work of Christ
no longer have to dread or fear death. I pray that a revival would 
come to world and that love for all man-kind would reign supreme...Amen.

Keep looking up, He is returning the way He left...
You are in the prayers of two who care...
Pastor Al & Marcie Sather

subject: thoughts to live by
verse: But thanks be to God Who gives us the victory through our Lord Jesus Christ. Therefore my dear brothers, stand firm. Let nothing move you. Always give yourselves fully to the work of the Lord, because you know that your labor in the Lord is not in vain. (I Corinthians 15:57, 58) NIV
reflection: What Paul is trying to get across to us is that because of the resurrection, nothing we do is useless. I believe that to often we become apathetic about serving the Lord because we don't see the results. But knowing that Christ has won the ultimate victory should really affect the way we live right now. Don't let discouragement over some lack of results keep you from doing the work of the Lord enthusiastically as you have opportunity.
prayer: Dear Heavenly Father, forgive me for not always doing your work as I should. Help me to forge forward doing your work in faith seizing every opportunity. Amen.
original_content:
I'll be gone all week-end so here is Saturdays Devo.

04/05/08 ~~~ (food for thought) ~~~ The best way to get the last word is to 
apologize...(Pro. 6:2, 3)

But thanks be to God Who gives us the victory through our Lord Jesus Christ...

Therefore my dear brothers, stand firm. Let nothing move you. Always
give yourselves fully to the work of the Lord, because you know that
your labor in the Lord is not in vain...(I Cor. 15:57, 58) NIV

Our Lesson for Today:

What Paul is trying to get across to us is that because of the resurrection,
nothing we do is useless. I believe that to often we become apathetic about
serving the Lord because we don't see the results...

But knowing that Christ has won the ultimate victory should really affect the 
way we live right now. Don't let discouragement over some lack of results
keep you from doing the work of the Lord enthusiastically as you have
opportunity...

Our Prayer for Today:
Dear Heavenly Father, forgive me for not always doing your
work as I should. Help me to forge forward doing your work
in faith seizing every opportunity...Amen

Keep looking up, and you will always have the Son in your eyes...
You are in the prayers of two who care...
Pastor Al & Marcie Sather

subject: thoughts to live by
verse: Now about the collection for God's people; Do what I told the Galatians churches to do. On the first day of every week, each one of you should set aside a sum of money in keeping with his income, saving it up, so that when I come no collections will have to be made. Then when I arrive, I will give letters of introduction to the men you approve and send them with your gift to Jerusalem. If it seems advisable for me to go also, they will accompany me. (I Corinthians 16:1-4) NIV
reflection: Each person was to set aside an amount proportionate to his income and bring what he had set aside for the Lord's work. The Christians in Jerusalem were suffering from poverty and famine. There are people today too who are suffering from poverty to the point where they can not buy enough food or clothing for themselves. Our churches should seek out the needs of people in our community and on the mission field and be ready to support them in anyway we can.
prayer: Dear Heavenly Father, I pray that You would give me a compassionate heart that I might not think only of myself but of the needs of others. Amen.
original_content:
04/08/08 ~~~(food for thought) ~~~The train of failure usually runs on the track of laziness...

Our Bible Verses for Today:

Now about the collection for God's people; Do what I told the

On the first day of every week, each one of you should set aside 
a sum of money in keeping with his income, saving it up, so that
when I come no collections will have to be made...

Then when I arrive, I will give letters of introduction to the men you
approve and send them with your gift to Jerusalem...

If it seems advisable for me to go also, they will accompany me...
(I Cor. 16:1-4) NIV

Our Lesson for Today:

Each person was to set aside an amount proportionate to his income
and bring what he had set aside for the Lord's work. The Christians in 
Jerusalem were suffering from poverty and famine...

There are people today too who are suffering from poverty to the
point where they can not buy enough food or clothing for themselves.

Our churches should seek out the needs of people in our community
and on the mission field and be ready to support them in anyway we can.

Our Prayer for Today:
Dear Heavenly Father, I pray that You would give me a compassionate 
heart that I might not think only of myself but of the needs of others...Amen.

Keep looking up, and you will always have the SON in your eyes...
You are in the prayers of two who care...
Pastor Al & Marcie Sather

subject: thoughts to live by
verse: If Timothy comes, see to it that he has nothing to fear while he is with you, for he is carrying on the work of the Lord, just as I am. No one, then, should refuse to accept Him, Send Him on His way in peace so that he may return to me. I am expecting him along with his brothers, (I Corinthians 16:10, 11) NIV
reflection: Paul was sending Timothy ahead to Corinth. Paul respected Timothy and had worked closely with him. Even though Timothy was young, Paul encourage the Corinthian Church to welcome him because he was doing the Lord's work. God's work is not limited by age.
prayer: Dear Heavenly Father, forgive me when I neglect to do the things you have for me to do. Help me to recognize the gifts I have been given and use them well. Amen.

subject: thoughts to live by
verse: Be on your guard; stand firm in the faith; be men of courage; be strong. Do everything in love. (I Corinthians 16:13, 14) NIV
reflection: As the Corinthians waited for Paul's next visit, they were told to: (1) be on their guard against spiritual dangers, (2) stand firm in the faith, (3) be courageous, (4) be strong, and (5) do everything with kindness and in love. Today as we wait for the return of Christ, we should follow the same instructions.
prayer: Dear Heavenly Father, help me to be faithful in following these instructions, as I wait for Your return. Amen.
original_content:
04/10/08 ~~~ (food for thought) ~~~ Forget yourself for others and

Be on your guard; stand firm in the faith; be men of courage;

Do everything in love...(I Cor. 16:13, 14) NIV

As the Corinthians waited for Paul's next visit, they were told to:
(1) be on their guard against spiritual dangers,
(2) stand firm in the faith,
(3) be courageous,
(4) be strong, and 
(5) do everything with kindness and in love...

Today as we wait for the return of Christ, we should follow the

subject: thoughts to live by
verse: Praise be to the God and Father of our Lord Jesus Christ, the Father of all compassion and the God of comfort, who comforts us in all our troubles, so that we can comfort those who are in trouble with the comfort we ourselves have received from God. For just as the sufferings of Christ flow over into our lives, so also through Christ our comfort overflows. (2 Corinthians 1:3-5) NIV
reflection: Many think that when God comforts us, our troubles should go away. But if that were always so, people would turn to God only out of a desire to be relieved of pain and not out of love for Him. We must understand that being "comforted" can also mean receiving strength, encouragement, and hope to deal with our troubles. The more we suffer, the more comfort God gives us. If you are feeling overwhelmed, allow God to comfort you. Remember that every trial you endure will help you comfort other people who are suffering similar troubles.
prayer: Dear Heavenly Father, I pray for the patience to wait on you. I pray that in that waiting I would also grow in faith and love toward You. Amen.
original_content:
04/11/08 ~~~ (food for thought) ~~~ The secret to success is to start from
scratch and keep on scratching...(Lk. 8:15)

of all compassion and the God of comfort,

who comforts us in all our troubles, so that we can comfort those who

For just as the sufferings of Christ flow over into our lives, so also

We must understand that being "comforted" can also mean receiving strength,

subject: thoughts to live by
verse: I think you ought to know, dear brothers and sisters, about the trouble we went through in the province or Asia. We were crushed and completely overwhelmed, and we thought we would never live through it. In fact, we expected to die. But as a result, we learned not to rely on ourselves but on God who can raise the dead. And He did deliver us from mortal danger, and we are confident that He will continue to deliver us. (2 Corinthians 1:8-10) NLT
reflection: We often depend on our own skills and abilities when life seems easy and only turn to God when we feel unable to help ourselves. But as we realize our own powerlessness without Him and our need for His constant help in our lives, we come to depend on Him more and more. God is our source of power, and we receive His help by keeping in touch with Him. With this attitude of dependence, problems will drive us to God rather than away from Him. Learn how to rely on God daily.
prayer: Dear Heavenly Father I thank You for always being there for me 24/7. I pray for continued strength to endure the trials of this life and that one day You will take me home to be with You. Amen.
original_content:
04/12/08 ~~~ (food for thought) ~~~ The secret to contentment is the realization
that life is a gift not a right...(1 Tim. 6:6, 7)

Our Bible Verse for Today:

I think you ought to know, dear brothers and sisters, about the trouble we went
through in the province or Asia. We were crushed and completely overwhelmed,
and we thought we would never live through it...

In fact, we expected to die. But as a result, we learned not to rely on ourselves
but on God who can raise the dead...

And He did deliver us from mortal danger, and we are confident that He will continue
to deliver us...(2 Cor. 1:8-10) NLT

Our Lesson for Today:

We often depend on our own skills and abilities when life seems easy 
and only turn to God when we feel unable to help ourselves...

But as we realize our own powerlessness without Him and our need
for His constant help in our lives, we come to depend on Him more
and more...

God is our source of power, and we receive His help by keeping in
touch with Him. With this attitude of dependence, problems will drive
us to God rather than away from Him. Learn how to rely on God daily...

Our Prayer for Today:
Dear Heavenly Father I thank You for always being there for
me 24/7. I pray for continued strength to endure the trials of
this life and that one day You will take me home to be with You...Amen.

Keep looking up, and the Son will always be in your eyes...
You are in the prayers of two who care...
Pastor Al & Marcie Sather

subject: thoughts to live by
verse: On Him we have set our hope that He will continue to deliver us, as you help us by your prayers. Then many will give thanks on our behalf for the gracious favor granted us in answer to the prayers of many. (2 Corinthians 1:10b, 11) NIV
reflection: Paul request prayer for himself and his companions as they traveled to spread God's message. Always remember to pray for pastors, teachers, missionaries, and others who are spreading the Good News. Satan is always challenging anyone making a real difference for God.
prayer: Dear heavenly Father, help me to always remember those who are doing Your work ~ I pray that You would protect them from the wiles of Satan. Give them wisdom ~ And give them a sensitivity to Your Holy Spirit's presence. Amen.
original_content:

Satan is always challenging anyone making a real difference

subject: thoughts to live by
verse: Now this is our boast: Our conscience testifies that we have conducted ourselves in the world, and especially in our relationships with you, in the holiness and sincerity that are from God. We have done so not according to worldly wisdom but according to God's grace. (2 Corinthians 1:12) NIV
reflection: Paul knew the importance of honesty and sincerity in word and actions, especially in a situation as in Corinth, where constructive criticism was necessary. So Paul did not approach with impressive human knowledge (earthly wisdom). God wants us to be real and transparent in all our relationships. If we aren't, we may end up lowering ourselves to spreading rumors, gossiping, and second guessing.
prayer: Dear Heavenly Father, I pray that I would always be open and forthright in my relationships with others. Forgive me when I am less than honest in all my words and actions. Amen.
original_content:
04/15/08 ~~~ (food for thought) ~~~ True faith and courage are like a kite an
opposing wind raises it higher...(Isa. 40:31)

Now this is our boast: Our conscience testifies that we have conducted
ourselves in the world, and especially in our relationships with you, in the
holiness and sincerity that are from God. We have done so not according

Our Lesson for Today:

Paul knew the importance of honesty and sincerity in word
and actions, especially in a situation as in Corinth, where

So Paul did not approach with impressive human knowledge

subject: thoughts to live by
verse: Because Jesus Christ, the Son of God, never wavers between yes and no, He is the one whom Timothy, Silas, and I preached to you, and He is the divine ~ Yes God's affirmation. For all of God's promises have been fulfilled in Him. That is why we say "Amen" when we give glory to God through Christ. (2 Corinthians 1:19, 20) NLT
reflection: All of God's promises of what the Messiah would be like are fulfilled in Christ ("He is the divine Yes"). Jesus was completely faithful in His ministry; He never sinned (I Peter 3:18). He faithfully died for us (Hebrews 2:9); and now He faithfully intercedes for us (Romans 8:34; Hebrews 4:14) Because Jesus Christ is faithful, Paul wanted to be faithful in his ministry. Christ's example should also be our directive, our guiding light.
prayer: Dear Heavenly Father, Help me to be sensitive to Your leading and guiding. Help me to remain faithful in my daily walk, so that Your light would shine through me. Amen.
original_content:
04/16/08 ~~~ (food for thought) ~~~ In order to receive direction from God you must
be able to receive correction from God...(Heb. 12:5b, 6)

Because Jesus Christ, the Son of God, never wavers between 
yes and no, He is the one whom Timothy, Silas, and I preached 
to you, and He is the divine ~ Yes God's affirmation...

For all of God's promises have been fulfilled in Him. That is why

Our Lesson for Today:

All of God's promises of what the Messiah would be like
are fulfilled in Christ ("He is the divine Yes"). Jesus was 
completely faithful in His ministry; He never sinned (I Pet. 3:18).

He faithfully died for us (Heb. 2:9); and now He faithfully

Because Jesus Christ is faithful, Paul wanted to be faithful

Christ's example should also be our directive, our guiding
light.

subject: thoughts to live by
verse: It is God who give us, along with you, the ability to stand firm for Christ. He has commissioned us, and He has identified us as His own by placing the Holy Spirit in our hearts as the first installment of everything He will give us. (2 Corinthians 2:21, 22) NLT
reflection: The Holy Spirit guarantees that we belong to God and will receive His benefits (Ephesians 1:13, 14). The Holy Spirit guarantees that salvation is ours now, and that we will receive so much more when Christ returns. The great comfort and power that the Holy Spirit gives in this life is a foretaste or a down payment of the benefits of eternal life in God's presence. With the privilege of belonging to God comes the responsibility of identifying ourselves as His faithful servants. Don't be ashamed to let others know that you are His.
prayer: Dear Heavenly Father, I thank You for the benefits that are mine In Christ Jesus. I thank You for looking at me as Your child, and I thank You for the gift of eternal life. Amen.
original_content:
04/17/08 ~~~ (food for today) ~~~ Don't mistake activity for achievement. Busyness
does not equal productiveness...(Lk. 10:40-42).

and He has identified us as His own by placing the Holy Spirit

2 Cor. 2:21, 22) NLT

With the privilege of belonging to God comes the responsibility of

Keep looking up, and the Son will always be in your eyes...

Pastor Al & Marcie Sather

subject: thoughts to live by
verse: Paul says, "I wrote you out of great distress and anguish of heart and with many tears, not to grieve you but to let you know the depth of my love for you. (2 Corinthians 2:4) NIV
reflection: Paul did not enjoy reprimanding his friends and fellow believers, but he cared enough about the Corinthians to confront them with their wrongdoing, Proverbs 27:6 says "Wounds from a friend are better than many kisses from an enemy." Sometimes our friends make choices that we know are wrong. If we ignore their behavior and let them continue in it, we won't be showing love to them. We show our love when we honestly share our concerns in order to help our friends to be their very best for God. When we don't make any move to help, we show that we are more concerned about being well liked than about what will happen to them.
prayer: Dear Heavenly Father, help me to always put my concern for others ahead of my own popularity. Help me correct with humility and love. Bless my e-mail friends with health and safety. Amen.
original_content:
04/18/08 ~~~ (food for thought) ~~~ It's the little things of life that determine
the big things...(Mt. 25:21b)

Yesterdays devo was not 2 Cor. 2:21, 22 but
2 Cor. 1:21, 22

Our Bible Verse for Today:

Paul says, "I wrote you out of great distress and anguish of heart 
and with many tears, not to grieve you but to let you know the 
depth of my love for you. (2 Cor. 2:4) NIV

Our lesson for Today:

Paul did not enjoy reprimanding his friends and fellow believers,
but he cared enough about the Corinthians to confront them with
their wrongdoing, Proverbs 27:6 says "Wounds from a friend are 
better than many kisses from an enemy."

Sometimes our friends make choices that we know are wrong. If
we ignore their behavior and let them continue in it, we won't be 
showing love to them...

We show our love when we honestly share our concerns in order 
to help our friends to be their very best for God. When we don't 
make any move to help, we show that we are more concerned 
about being well liked than about what will happen to them...

Our Prayer for Today:
Dear Heavenly Father, help me to always put my concern for others
ahead of my own popularity. Help me correct with humility and love.
Bless my e-mail friends with health and safety...Amen.

Keep looking up, and the Son will always be in your eyes...
You are in the prayers of two who care... 
Pastor Al & Marcie Sather

subject: thoughts to live by
verse: Paul says, "If anyone has cause grief, he has not so much grieved me as he has grieved all of you, to some extent--not to put it too severely. The punishment inflicted on him by the majority is sufficient for him. Now instead, you ought to forgive and comfort him, so that he will no be overwhelmed by excessive sorrow. I urge you, therefore, to reaffirm your love for him. The reason I wrote to you was to see if you would stand the test and be obedient in everything. If you forgive anyone, I also forgive him, and what I have forgiven, if there was anything to forgive, I have forgiven in the sight of Christ for your sake. (2 Corinthians 2:5-10) NIV
reflection: Paul explains that it was time to forgive the man who had been punished by the church and had evidently repented. Now he needed forgiveness, acceptance, and comfort. Satan would gain an advantage if they permanently separated this man from the congregation rather than forgiving and restoring him. Church discipline should seek restoration. There are two mistakes the church often makes: being too lenient and not correcting mistakes ~ or being too harsh and not forgiving the sinner. There is a time to confront and a time to comfort.
prayer: Dear Heavenly Father, when the need arises to discipline a fellow believer, help me to do so with a humble heart. Amen.
original_content:
04/19/08 ~~~ (food for thought) ~~~ The doors of opportunity are marked
"Push" and "Pull" (Pro. 13:4)

Our Bible Verses for Today:

Paul says, "If anyone has cause grief, he has not so much grieved me as he 
has grieved all of you, to some extent--not to put it too severely...

The punishment inflicted on him by the majority is sufficient for him...

Now instead, you ought to forgive and comfort him, so that he will no be overwhelmed by excessive sorrow...

I urge you, therefore, to reaffirm your love for him. The reason I wrote to you
was to see if you would stand the test and be obedient in everything...

If you forgive anyone, I also forgive him, and what I have forgiven, if there was 
anything to forgive, I have forgiven in the sight of Christ for your sake...
(2 Cor. 2:5-10) NIV

Our Lesson for Today:

Paul explains that it was time to forgive the man who had been punished
by the church and had evidently repented. Now he needed forgiveness, 
acceptance, and comfort...

Satan would gain an advantage if they permanently separated this man 
from the congregation rather than forgiving and restoring him...

Church discipline should seek restoration. There are two mistakes the church
often makes: being too lenient and not correcting mistakes ~ or being too
harsh and not forgiving the sinner...

There is a time to confront and a time to comfort...

Our Prayer for Today:
Dear Heavenly Father, when the need arises to discipline a fellow
believer, help me to do so with a humble heart...Amen.

Keep looking up, and the Son will be in your eyes...
You are in the prayers of two who care...
Pastor Al & Marcie Sather...

subject: thoughts to live by
verse: Paul's says, "We are to God the aroma of Christ among those who are being saved and to those who are preaching. To the one we are the smell of death; to the other, the fragrance of life. And who is equal to such a task?" (2 Corinthians 2:15, 16) NIV
reflection: When Christians preach the Good News, it is good news to some and repulsive news to others. Believers recognize the life-giving fragrance of the message. But to nonbelievers it smells foul, like death ~ their own. Paul says, "Who is adequate" for the task of representing Christ? Well our adequacy is always from God (1 Corinthians 15:10; 2 Corinthians 3:5). He has already commissioned and sent us (Matthew 28:18-20). He has given us His Holy Spirit to enable us to speak with Christ's power. He keeps His eyes on us, protecting us as we realize that God has equipped us, we can over come our feelings of inadequacy. In our serving Christ it requires that we focus on what He can do through us, not on what we can't do by ourselves.
prayer: Dear Heavenly Father, Forgive me when I doubt my capabilities, Because You have told us that all things are possible with You. So I pray Dear Father that You would turn my doubts into faith, that I may realize that I can do all things in You. Amen.
original_content:
04/21/08 ~~~ (food for thought) ~~~ You cannot win if you do not begin... (2 Cor. 8:11)

Our Bible Verses for Today:

Paul's says, "We are to God the aroma of Christ among those who are
being saved and to those who are preaching...

To the one we are the smell of death; to the other, the fragrance of life.
And who is equal to such a task?" (2 Cor. 2:15, 16) NIV

Our Lesson for Today:

When Christians preach the Good News, it is good news to some and
repulsive news to others. Believers recognize the life-giving fragrance 
of the message. But to non-believers it smells foul, like death ~ their own...

Paul says, "Who is adequate" for the task of representing Christ? Well
our adequacy is always from God (1 Cor. 15:10; 2 Cor. 3:5). He has already
commissioned and sent us (Mt. 28:18-20)...

He has given us His Holy Spirit to enable us to speak with Christ's power.
He keeps His eyes on us, protecting us as we realize that God has equipped
us, we can over come our feelings of inadequacy...

In our serving Christ it requires that we focus on what He can do through
us, not on what we can't do by ourselves...

Our Prayer for Today:
Dear Heavenly Father, Forgive me when I doubt my capabilities,
Because You have told us that all things are possible with You.
So I pray Dear Father that You would turn my doubts into faith,
that I may realize that I can do all things in You...Amen.

Keep looking up, with Him not job is to great...
You are in the prayers of two who care...
Pastor Al & Marcie Sather

subject: thoughts to live by
verse: Such confidences as this is ours through Christ before God. Not that we are competent in ourselves to claim anything for ourselves, but our competence comes from God. (2 Corinthians 3:4, 5) NIV
reflection: Paul was not boasting he gave God the credit for all his accomplishments. While false teachers boast about their own power and success, Paul expresses his humility before God. No one can claim to be adequate without God's help. No one is competent to carry out the responsibilities of God's calling in his or her own strength. Without the Holy Spirit's enabling, our natural talent can carry us only so far. As Christ's witnesses, we need the character and special strength that only God gives.
prayer: Dear Heavenly Father, I thank you for the Holy Spirit's work in my heart. I pray that I would continually follow His leading. Amen.
original_content:
04/23/08 ~~~ (food for thought) ~~~ What you do today affects your tomorrows...

Our Bible Verses for Today:

Such confidences as this is ours through Christ before God...

Not that we are competent in ourselves to claim anything for
ourselves, but our competence comes from God...(2 Cor 3:4, 5) NIV

Our Lesson for Today:

Paul was not boasting he gave God the credit for all his accomplishments...

While false teachers boast about their own power and success, Paul 
expresses his humility before God. No one can claim to be adequate
without God's help. No one is competent to carry out the responsibilities
of God's calling in his or her own strength.

Without the Holy Spirit's enabling, our natural talent can carry us only so
far. As Christ's witnesses, we need the character and special strength
that only God gives...

Our Prayer for Today:
Dear Heavenly Father, I thank you for the Holy Spirit's
work in my heart. I pray that I would continually follow
His leading...Amen.

Keep looking up, while you stand your ground...
You are in the prayers of two who care...
Pastor Al & Marcie

subject: thoughts to live by
verse: He has made us competent as ministers of a new covenant ~ not of the letter but of the Spirit; for the letter kills, but the Spirit gives life. (2 Corinthians 3:6) NIV
reflection: "The old way ends in death, in the new way, the Holy Spirit gives life" means that trying to be saved by keeping the Old Testament laws will end in death. Only by believing in the Lord Jesus Christ can a person receive eternal life through the Holy Spirit. No one but Jesus has ever fulfilled the Law perfectly; so, the whole world is condemned to death. The Law makes people realize their sin, but it cannot give life. Under the new covenant, which means promise or agreement, eternal life come from the Holy Spirit. The Spirit gives life to all who believe in Christ.
prayer: Dear Heavenly Father, I thank You for the faith which the Holy Spirit plants in me, I thank you that my salvation comes by grace through faith in Jesus Christ. Amen.
original_content:
04/24/08 ~~~(food for thought) ~~~ All things are difficult before they are easy...

Our Bible Verse for Today:

He has made us competent as ministers of a new covenant ~ 
not of the letter but of the Spirit; for the letter kills, but the 
Spirit gives life...(2 Cor. 3:6) NIV

Our Lesson for Today:

"The old way ends in death, in the new way, the Holy Spirit gives life"
means that trying to be saved by keeping the Old Testament laws
will end in death...

Only by believing in the Lord Jesus Christ can a person receive 
eternal life through the Holy Spirit. No one but Jesus has ever fulfilled 
the Law perfectly; so, the whole world is condemned to death...

The Law makes people realize their sin, but it cannot give life. Under
the new covenant, which means promise or agreement, eternal life come
from the Holy Spirit. The Spirit gives life to all who believe in Christ...

Our Prayer for Today:
Dear Heavenly Father, I thank You for the faith which the 
Holy Spirit plants in me, I thank you that my salvation comes
by grace through faith in Jesus Christ...Amen.

Keep looking up, He answers prayer...
You are in the prayers of two who care...
Pastor Al & Marcie Sather

subject: thoughts to live by
verse:
Now if the ministry that brought death, which was engraved in letters on stone, came with glory, so that Israelites could not look steadily as the face of Moses because of its glory, fading though it was, will not the ministry of the Spirit be more glorious? If the ministry that condemns men is glorious, how much more glorious is the
ministry that brings righteousness! (2 Corinthians 3:7-9) NIV
reflection: Paul contrasts the glory of the 10 commandments with the glory of the new covenant. If the Law that leads to death was glorious, how much more glorious is God's plan which gives us life through the Spirit. Paul says, if the old covenant had its glory (and it certainly did), just imagine how glorious the new covenant is. The law was wonderful because, even though it condemned us, it pointed us to Christ. But in the New Covenant, the law and the promise are fulfilled. By grace, and faith in Christ's finished work we can be made right with God!
prayer: Dear Heavenly Father I thank You for Your superior plan which took the place of the "Old Covenant." I thank You for the commandments because they do remind us of our need for a Savior. Amen.
original_content:
04/25/08 ~~~(food for thought) ~~~ Honesty is always the best policy...

Our Bible Verses for Today"

Now if the ministry that brought death, which was engraved in
letters on stone, came with glory, so that Israelites could not
look steadily as the face of Moses because of its glory, fading 
though it was,

will not the ministry of the Spirit be more glorious? If the ministry
that condemns men is glorious, how much more glorious is the
ministry that brings righteousness! (2 Cor. 3:7-9) NIV

Our Lesson for Today:

Paul contrasts the glory of the 10 commandments with the glory of
the new covenant. If the Law that leads to death was glorious, how
much more glorious is God's plan which gives us life through the Spirit...

Paul says, if the old covenant had its glory (and it certainly did), just
imagine how glorious the new covenant is...

The law was wonderful because, even though it condemned us, it
pointed us to Christ. But in the New Covenant, the law and the promise 
are fulfilled...

By grace, and faith in Christ's finished work we can be made right with God!

Our Prayer for Today:
Dear Heavenly Father I thank You for Your superior plan which took the
place of the "Old Covenant." I thank You for the commandments because
they do remind us of our need for a Savior...Amen.

Keep looking up, He will always be there for You...
You are in the Prayers of two who care...
Pastor Al & Marcie Sather

subject: thoughts to live by
verse: Even to this day when Moses is read, a veil covers their hearts. But whenever anyone turns to the Lord, the veil is taken away. Now the Lord is the Spirit, and where the Spirit of the Lord is, there is freedom. (2 Corinthians 3:15-17) NIV
reflection: Those who were trying to be saved by keeping the Old Testament Law were soon tied up in rules and ceremonies. But now, through the Holy Spirit, God provides freedom from sin and condemnation (Romans 8:1). When we trust Christ to save us, He removes our heavy burden of trying to please Him, and our guilt for failing to do so. By trusting Christ we are loved, accepted, forgiven, and freed to live for Him."Wherever the Spirit of the Lord is, He gives freedom."
prayer: I thank You for providing freedom from sin and condemnation. I thank You that I am loved, accepted, and free to live for Christ. I thank You for the sure way You have provided to eternal life. Amen.
original_content:
04/26/08 ~~~ (food for thought) ~~~Happiness is like potato salad ~ 
when shared with others it's a picnic...

Our Bible Verses for Today: 

Even to this day when Moses is read, a veil covers their hearts.

But whenever anyone turns to the Lord, the veil is taken away.

Now the Lord is the Spirit, and where the Spirit of the Lord is,
there is freedom... (2 Cor 3:15-17) NIV

Our Lesson for Today:

Those who were trying to be saved by keeping the Old Testament
Law were soon tied up in rules and ceremonies. But now, through
the Holy Spirit, God provides freedom from sin and condemnation
(Ro. 8:1)...

When we trust Christ to save us, He removes our heavy burden of 
trying to please Him, and our guilt for failing to do so. By trusting 
Christ we are loved, accepted, forgiven, and freed to live for Him.

"Wherever the Spirit of the Lord is, He gives freedom."

Our Prayer for Today:
I thank You for providing freedom from sin and condemnation.
I thank You that I am loved, accepted, and free to live for Christ.
I thank You for the sure way You have provided to eternal life...Amen.

Keep looking up, He is the Way the Truth, and the Life...
You are in the prayers of two who care...
Pastor Al & Marcie Sather

subject: thoughts to live by
verse: And we, who with unveiled faces all reflect the Lord's glory, are being transformed into His likeness with ever-increasing glory, which comes from the Lord, who is the Spirit. (2 Corinthians 3:18)
reflection: The glory that the Spirit imparts to the believer is more excellent and lasts longer than the glory that Moses experienced. By gazing at the nature of God with unveiled minds, we can be more like Him. In the Good News, we see the truth about Christ, and it transforms us morally as we understand and apply it. Through learning about Christ's life, we can understand how wonderful God is and what He is really like. As our knowledge deepens, the Holy Spirit helps us to change. Becoming Christ-like is a progressive experience (see Romans 8:29; Galatians 4:19; 1 John 3:2). The more closely we follow Christ, the more we will be like Him.
prayer: Dear Heavenly Father, I pray that You would help me to become more knowledgeable about You. Help me to grow in wisdom so that I would become more Christ-like. Amen.
original_content:
04/28/08 ~~~ (food for thought) ~~~ Traveling in the company of those we love
is home in motion...

Our Bible Verse for Today:

And we, who with unveiled faces all reflect the Lord's glory,
are being transformed into His likeness with ever-increasing
glory, which comes from the Lord, who is the Spirit...(2 Cor. 3:18)

Our Lesson for Today:

The glory that the Spirit imparts to the believer is more excellent
and lasts longer than the glory that Moses experienced...

By gazing at the nature of God with unveiled minds, we can be 
more like Him. In the Good News, we see the truth about Christ,
and it transforms us morally as we understand and apply it...

Through learning about Christ's life, we can understand how 
wonderful God is and what He is really like. As our knowledge
deepens, the Holy Spirit helps us to change...

Becoming Christ-like is a progressive experience (see Ro. 8:29;
Gal. 4:19; 1 Jn. 3:2). The more closely we follow Christ, the 
more we will be like Him...

Our Prayer for Today:
Dear Heavenly Father, I pray that You would help me to
become more knowledgeable about You. Help me to grow 
in wisdom so that I would become more Christ-like...

Keep looking up, He will impart onto you His glory...
You are in the prayers of two who care...
Pastor Al & Marcie Sather

subject: thoughts to live by
verse: Therefore, since through God's mercy we have this ministry, we do not lose heart. Rather, we have renounced secret and shameful ways; we do not use deception, nor do we distort the Word of God. on the contrary, by setting forth the truth plainly we commend ourselves to every man's conscience in the sight of God. (2 Corinthians 4:1, 2) NIV
reflection: Preachers, and teachers, and anyone else who talks about Jesus Christ must remember that they stand in God's presence ~ He hears every word. He also sees our every action. When you tell people about Christ, be careful not to distort the message to please those you are sharing it with. Proclaim the truth of God's Word and allow the Holy Spirit to do the rest.
prayer: Dear Heavenly Father, when I have occasion to share Your Word, I pray that I would do it in such a way it would be pleasing to You, and not merely to tickle the ears of my listeners. Amen.
original_content:
04/29/08 ~~~ (food for thought) ~~~ True peace comes only from God. (Jn. 14:27)

Our Bible Verses for Today:

Therefore, since through God's mercy we have this ministry,
we do not lose heart.

Rather, we have renounced secret and shameful ways;
we do not use deception, nor do we distort the Word of God.
on the contrary, by setting forth the truth plainly we commend 
ourselves to every man's conscience in the sight of God...
(2 Cor. 4:1, 2) NIV

Our Lesson for Today:

Preachers, and teachers, and anyone else who talks about Jesus
Christ must remember that they stand in God's presence ~ He
hears every word. He also sees our every action...

When you tell people about Christ, be careful not to distort the message
to please those you are sharing it with. Proclaim the truth of God's Word
and allow the Holy Spirit to do the rest...

Our Prayer for Today:
Dear Heavenly Father, when I have occasion to share 
Your Word, I pray that I would do it in such a way it
would be pleasing to You, and not merely to tickle the
ears of my listeners...Amen.

Keep looking up, and He will give you peace...
You are in the prayers of two who care...
Pastor Al & Marcie Sather

subject: thoughts to live by
verse: Even if our Gospel is veiled, it is veiled to those who are perishing. The God of this age has blinded the minds of unbelievers, so that they can not see the light of the gospel of the glory of Christ, who is the image of God. (2 Corinthians 4:3, 4) NIV.
reflection: The Good News is available to everyone, except to those who refuse to believe. Satan is "the god of this evil world." His work is to deceive, and he has blinded those who do not believe in Christ (see 2 Corinthians 11:14, 15). The allure of money, power, and pleasure blinds people to the light of Christ's Good News. Those who reject Christ and prefer their own pursuits have unknowingly made Satan their god.
prayer: Dear Heavenly Father, I thank You for the "Good News" of the Gospel. I pray that You would help me to continually reject Satan's devious ways. Bless my e-mail friends with good health and safety. Amen.
original_content:
04/30/08 ~~~ (food for thought) ~~~ Life is not when or then - it is now...

Even if our Gospel is veiled, it is veiled to those 
who are perishing...

The God of this age has blinded the minds of unbelievers,
so that they can not see the light of the gospel of the glory

The allure of money, power, and pleasure blinds people to

Keep looking up, He wants to be your Savior...
You are in the prayers of two who care...
Pastor Al & Marcie Sather

subject: thoughts to live by
verse: We do not preach ourselves, but Jesus Christ as Lord, and ourselves as your servants for Jesus' sake. (2 Corinthians 4:5) NIV
reflection: The focus of Paul's preaching was not himself but Christ. When you witness, tell people about what Christ has done and not about your abilities and accomplishments. People must be introduced to Christ, not to you. And if you hear someone preaching about himself or his own ideas rather than about Christ, beware ~ he is a false teacher.
prayer: Dear Heavenly Father, instill in me a willingness to serve others even when it requires a sacrifice of time and personal desires. Help me to be ready to serve others, even when they do not measure up to my expectations. Amen.
original_content:
05/01/08 ~~~ (food for thought) ~~~ It's not about falling down, it's about how you get up...

People must be introduced to Christ, not to you. And if you hear

You are in the prayers of two who care...
Pastor Al & Marcie Sather
